content.body: It's surprising how slow MDN is to respond
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It's surprising how slow MDN is to respond

content.body: Anyone know offhand if we have a standard across APIs for how to camelcase a non-iniitial "CSS"? Does it stay capitalized, or get initialcased? (Specifically, term I'm asking about is `checkVisibilityCSS`, as a dictionary entry in a new API)
content.formatted_body: Anyone know offhand if we have a standard across APIs for how to camelcase a non-iniitial "CSS"? Does it stay capitalized, or get initialcased? (Specifically, term I'm asking about is checkVisibilityCSS, as a dictionary entry in a new API)

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Anyone know offhand if we have a standard across APIs for how to camelcase a non-iniitial "CSS"? Does it stay capitalized, or get initialcased? (Specifically, term I'm asking about is `checkVisibilityCSS`, as a dictionary entry in a new API)

Anyone know offhand if we have a standard across APIs for how to camelcase a non-iniitial "CSS"? Does it stay capitalized, or get initialcased? (Specifically, term I'm asking about is checkVisibilityCSS, as a dictionary entry in a new API)

content.body: The ones I could think of all *start* with CSS, so aren't quite as helpful for precedent, but do suggest it should stay all-caps.

content.body:
> <@tabatkins:matrix.org> Anyone know offhand if we have a standard across APIs for how to camelcase a non-iniitial "CSS"? Does it stay capitalized, or get initialcased? (Specifically, term I'm asking about is `checkVisibilityCSS`, as a dictionary entry in a new API)

It stays capitalized https://w3ctag.github.io/design-principles/#casing-rules
